modele.occupant.objetMobile

Class ObjetMobile

  • java.lang.Object
    • modele.occupant.Occupant
      • modele.occupant.objetMobile.ObjetMobile
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Questionnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Cheater, Hunter, Sage

    public abstract class ObjetMobile
extends Occupant
    The ObjetMobile class is an abstract class that represents a mobile object in a grid, with attributes such as waiting time, direction, and tool possession.

    • Method Detail

      • containPierre

        public boolean containPierre(Position p,
                             Grille m)
        This function checks if a given position in a grid contains a stone.
        Parameters:
        p - The parameter "p" is of type "Position" and represents a position on a grid.
        m - The parameter "m" is of type "Grille", which is likely a class representing a grid or board in a game or simulation. It is being used to retrieve a list of occupants at a given position "p".
        Returns:
        The method `containPierre` returns a boolean value. It returns `true` if there is a `Pierre` object at the given `Position` in the `Grille` object, and `false` otherwise.

      • containObjetMobile

        public boolean containObjetMobile(Position p,
                                  Grille m)
        This function checks if a mobile object is present at a given position in a grid.
        Parameters:
        p - The position being checked for the presence of an ObjetMobile occupant.
        m - m is an object of the class Grille, which represents a grid or a board.
        Returns:
        A boolean value indicating whether there is an instance of the class ObjetMobile at the given position in the Grille object.

      • randomDir

        public void randomDir()
        The function sets the direction of movement for an object randomly in one of eight possible directions.

      • getNextPosition

        public Position getNextPosition()
        This function returns a new position object with updated X and Y coordinates based on the current direction and maximum X value of the grid.
        Returns:
        A new Position object with the X and Y coordinates incremented by the values of dirX and dirY respectively, and the maxX value of the grid.

      • getObjetMobile

        public Occupant getObjetMobile(Position p,
                               Grille m)
        This Java function returns an instance of an ObjetMobile if it exists at a given position in a Grille object.
        Parameters:
        p - The position of the object mobile that we want to retrieve from the grid.
        m - The parameter "m" is of type "Grille", which represents a grid or a board. It is likely that this method is part of a larger program that involves a game or a simulation where objects can move around on a grid. The "m" parameter is used to access the grid and
        Returns:
        The method is returning an object of type `Occupant` which represents a mobile object located at a specific position in a grid. If there is no mobile object at the given position, the method returns `null`.

      • mouvement

        public void mouvement(Grille g)
        This function controls the movement of an occupant on a grid, checking for collisions with other occupants and objects.
        Parameters:
        g - Grille object, which represents the game board/grid.
